intro: Hieracium sellii, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Hieracium sellii is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
